name: WordCounter
0:
”Alexa ask Word Counter how many letters are in "George Washington"”
”Count "Seventh Annual Fair"”
”How many letters are in "John Smith"”
skdetail:
This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: word counter
des:
Do you run a silkscreen or iron-on business? 

This skill will help you to quickly determine how much to charge your customer, based on the number of letters in any given name or phrase.

Are you in charge of the soccer team and want to iron-on everyone's name on their jersey and need to know how many of each letters to buy?

1. This skill will help you determine how many letters are needed to purchase in creating banners or iron-on T-shirts. 
2. Decide what words to print, when only a specific number of characters are allowed on a T-shirt

Note: It does not count spaces.

Example: Suppose that you need to buy enough letters to iron-on "George Washington" on a T-shirt. This skill will tell you that you need to buy:

16 letters:

1-a
2-e
3-g
1-h
1-i
2-n
2-o
1-r
1-s
1-t
1-w

You could do this by hand, but it will take time and can be error prone, and if you have a customer in front of you, isn't it easier and quicker to just ask Alexa, and in seconds you can tell your costumer "that will be 16 letters, and at $2 a letter, your total is $32 dollars."
priv: The developer reported that this skill does not collect personal information.
